messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] weird weather was cheap flights
messages.msgSnippet: ... back ... longest ... Yes, well, we had to have a little excitement! It keeps life... interesting :-) Cacie got a copy of Cyrano at the used book sale last
messages.messageBody:
On Tue, 21 May 2002 12:42:42 -0700 "Karin" <curtkar@...> writes:
> Walking distance, except for the mad rush after the play to drive you
back
> to your hotel before check-out time was over! That was one of the
longest
> plays I've ever been to! <g>

Yes, well, we had to have a little excitement! It keeps life...
interesting :-)

Cacie got a copy of Cyrano at the used book sale last weekend, BTW. I
love Bag Day...
>
> I was thinking about you today, Dar, after watching the weather and
seeing
> the nasty storms and tornados in the Sacramento area and even snow at
the
> higher elevations! Everything okay with you guys out on the farm? I
> hope so.

It was really stormy. I went from thinking it was time to get the swamp
cooler going to turning on the heater, all within 24 hours or so. They
even cancelled softball practice - I guess they'll play in rain, but not
in storms.

I didn't know about tornados, though. The one thing I really miss living
out here is getting a daily newspaper... I don't like reading it online,
but I miss knowing what's going on...

It's windy again today, although yesterday was lovely. My dad's coming to
visit from Tucson on Sunday, he said it's over 100 there already...

Dar

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] weird weather was cheap flights
messages.msgSnippet: We got a really nice room throught priceline ... Walking distance, except for the mad rush after the play to drive you back to your hotel before check-out time
messages.messageBody:
We got a really nice room throught priceline
> when we went up to see Karin in Phoenix, I think it was a Howard
> Johnson's, walking distance from the play we were seeing, and only $30.
>
> Dar
>


Walking distance, except for the mad rush after the play to drive you back
to your hotel before check-out time was over! That was one of the longest
plays I've ever been to! <g>

I was thinking about you today, Dar, after watching the weather and seeing
the nasty storms and tornados in the Sacramento area and even snow at the
higher elevations! Everything okay with you guys out on the farm? I hope so.

Karin
